triples.evidence: any discrete function - let’s call it g of n - can be expressed as a weighted sum of shifted delta functions.
triples.o: weighted sum of shifted delta functions

triples.evidence: When we add up all these scaled and shifted impulses, we rebuild the function g.
any discrete function - let’s call it g of n - can be expressed as a weighted sum of shifted delta functions.

evidence: Any discrete function can be expressed as a weighted sum of shifted delta functions.
This formula tells us that each sample of g contributes one impulse, located at n equals k, and scaled by g at that k.
By adding these three impulses together, we effectively reconstruct the original signal, point by point.

concepts.term: it allows us to treat any discrete-time signal as a sum of building blocks - scaled and shifted impulses - making analysis and filtering much easier later on

evidence: By adding these three impulses together, we effectively reconstruct the original signal, point by point.
